title: Hollyoaks spoilers: James plots revenge as Harry is laid to rest
text:
(Picture: Lime Pictures)

James Nightingale (Gregory Finnegan) was left devastated several weeks back in Hollyoaks when he learned that boyfriend Harry Thompson (Parry Glasspool) had bee murdered and he was forced to identity his body. With Harry’s funeral approaching, the solicitor vows revenge on the person responsible for his death.

This year got off to such a promising start for James. Harry returned and, before long, James welcomed his boyfriend back into his life, and the pair started anew. However, problems arose when Harry became embroiled in police investigation following Grace Black (Tamara Wall) having been injured in a hit-and-run involving his car.

James grew paranoid and found himself unable to trust anything that Harry had to say. As a result, he began drugging his boyfriend — something which ultimately led to the breakdown of their relationship.

(Picture: Lime Pictures)

Harry was later murdered by Breda (Moya Brady), and James later had to identify his body. However, he remains unaware of who killed his boyfriend.

In the coming episodes, the day of Harry’s funeral arrives and — determined to get to the bottom of what really happened —James sets out to clear his own name. He struggles during the service, and finds it difficult to walk as he approaches the coffin off his one true love.

Later, at The Dog, Grace takes it upon herself to reveal what really happened regarding her accident, as she plays Mercedes’ confession aloud — a confession which also features her admitting that she framed Harry for the incident.

The while village turns on The Dog landlady — James included — as he now believes that she had a part to play in Harry’s death.

Mercedes is set to be shot as part of the upcoming ‘Who Shot Mercedes?’ storyline, and — with James on the warpath — could he perhaps be the one to pull the trigger?

One to watch: Friday 1st November at 7pm on E4.
